In the event of ambiguity or lack of clear governmental announcement, the resolution will be based on the most reliable and authoritative sources available at the time, including but not limited to official government publications, verified news reports, and statements from key government officials. If the policy is announced but its implementation is significantly delayed or cancelled, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Sweden implement a digital currency as an official means of transaction by the end of 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Swedish government or its official monetary authority (e.g., Sveriges Riksbank) has officially announced and implemented a digital currency that is recognized as legal tender for all types of transactions within Sweden. The digital currency must be fully operational and accessible to the public, with clear guidelines and infrastructure for its use in everyday transactions. 

For the purpose of this question, a "digital currency" is defined as a currency that exists in digital or electronic form, which may include but is not limited to, central bank digital currencies (CBDCs), digital versions of the Swedish krona, or any new digital currency introduced by the authorities. 

In the event that multiple digital currencies are introduced, at least one must meet the above criteria for the question to resolve as Yes. 

If the digital currency is announced but not fully implemented by the resolution date, or if it is only used for specific types of transactions, the question will resolve as No. 

Authoritative sources for confirmation include official government or Sveriges Riksbank announcements, press releases, and legal documents.

title: Will a major cryptocurrency undergo a significant protocol change due to a breakthrough in quantum computing by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major cryptocurrency (defined as one of the top 10 by market capitalization at the time of the event) implements a significant protocol change specifically attributed to advancements in quantum computing. The protocol change must be:

- Publicly announced by the official development team or governing body of the cryptocurrency.
- Aimed at addressing security vulnerabilities exposed by quantum computing advancements.
- Implemented and active on the main network of the cryptocurrency.

A "significant protocol change" is defined as an update or modification that fundamentally alters the cryptographic algorithms or security protocols used by the cryptocurrency to protect transactions, wallet addresses, or the integrity of the blockchain.

In the event that multiple cryptocurrencies meet these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first instance. If no such change is publicly announced and implemented by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

Authoritative sources for confirmation include official cryptocurrency project announcements, verified news outlets, and peer-reviewed publications in the field of quantum computing.

title: Will a former or current Major League Baseball player run for political office in the United States by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, any individual who has played in Major League Baseball (MLB) at any point in their career announces their candidacy for any elected political office within the United States, including but not limited to local, state, or federal positions. The announcement must be verifiable through credible media outlets, official campaign announcements, or direct confirmation from the individual's official social media accounts or website. In the event of a dispute over the individual's MLB player status, the official MLB records and player rosters will serve as the authoritative source. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Tesla announce the construction of a new Gigafactory in Spain by the end of 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Tesla, Inc. announces the initiation of construction for a new Gigafactory in Spain before January 1, 2025. The announcement must be verifiable through official Tesla communications, including but not limited to press releases, official social media posts, or direct statements from Elon Musk or other authorized Tesla spokespersons. The Gigafactory must be explicitly stated to be located within the geographical boundaries of Spain, and the construction must be intended to start before the end of 2025. In the absence of a clear announcement by Tesla, Inc. regarding the construction of a Gigafactory in Spain by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. For the purpose of this question, a 'Gigafactory' is defined as a large-scale manufacturing facility operated by Tesla, Inc. that is primarily focused on the production of electric vehicles and/or battery cells. Announcements made in any language will be considered valid, provided they can be accurately translated and verified.

title: Will Australia commit to a manned lunar mission by 2035?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2035, the Australian government, or a recognized space agency or private spaceflight company based in Australia, officially announces and commits to conducting a manned lunar mission. The commitment must include a clear statement of intent to send at least one Australian astronaut to the lunar surface, along with a planned timeline for the mission's launch. The announcement must be verifiable through official government channels, press releases, or major media outlets. In the event of ambiguity or partial commitments, the question will resolve as No unless there is an unequivocal declaration of a manned lunar mission. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Virginia launch a state-funded satellite into orbit by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the state of Virginia, either through its government agencies or in partnership with private entities, successfully launches a satellite into Earth's orbit before January 1, 2030. The satellite must be intended for a non-military purpose, such as environmental monitoring, educational projects, or telecommunications, and must achieve a stable orbit for at least 30 days to be considered successful. Launches conducted by private entities must be explicitly funded or co-funded by the state of Virginia, with clear documentation of the state's financial or resource contribution. In the event of a dispute regarding the launch's funding or purpose, the final decision will be made based on the most reliable and authoritative sources available at the time of resolution. If no launch has occurred by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major aerospace company announce a project involving blockchain technology for supply chain management by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a major aerospace company (defined as one of the top 10 aerospace companies by revenue as of 2023, including but not limited to Boeing, Airbus, Lockheed Martin, Northrop Grumman, Raytheon Technologies, General Dynamics, BAE Systems, Leonardo S.p.A., and Safran) announces a project that involves the use of blockchain technology for managing its supply chain. The announcement must be verifiable through official company press releases, filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), or other authoritative public disclosures. In the event of a dispute regarding the legitimacy of the announcement, the resolution will defer to the most authoritative source available at the time of resolution. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. Projects that are announced but not specifically described as involving blockchain technology for supply chain management will not meet the resolution criteria. In the case where a company is acquired or merges with another entity, the resulting entity will be considered for the resolution if it remains within the top 10 aerospace companies by revenue.

title: Will the Biden administration implement a regulatory framework specifically for cryptocurrencies that includes consumer protection by the end of 2024?
body:
The question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the Biden administration has officially announced and implemented a regulatory framework for cryptocurrencies that includes specific measures for consumer protection. This framework must be documented in official government publications or announcements, such as the Federal Register, press releases from relevant regulatory bodies (e.g., the Securities and Exchange Commission, the Commodity Futures Trading Commission), or official statements from the White House. The framework should address, at a minimum, the following areas: 

- Standards for transparency and disclosure by cryptocurrency issuers and platforms
- Anti-fraud and anti-manipulation measures
- Consumer rights and protections in the event of loss or theft
- Regulatory oversight mechanisms for cryptocurrency exchanges and wallets

In the absence of a comprehensive framework, the question will resolve as No. If the administration announces a framework but it is not fully implemented by the deadline, the question will also resolve as No. In the event of ambiguity regarding the implementation status, the resolution will be based on the most authoritative and recent information available from the aforementioned sources.

title: Will the Democratic Party (US) hold a majority in both the House of Representatives and the Senate simultaneously at any point before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, at any point before January 1, 2030, the Democratic Party holds more than 50% of the seats in both the House of Representatives and the Senate of the United States simultaneously. The count of seats must be based on the official results of elections, special elections, or appointments that are recognized by the relevant legal and governmental authorities. In the event of a tie in the Senate, the Vice President's party affiliation will determine the majority. If the Democratic Party holds exactly 50% of the seats in the Senate and the Vice President is a Democrat, this will be considered a majority. The resolution will not be affected by temporary absences or vacancies unless they last for more than 6 months without a resolution, such as a special election or appointment. In such a case, the majority status will be based on the number of active, filled seats. If there is a dispute over the legitimacy of any members or the results of an election, the resolution will defer to the final decision of the highest relevant legal authority.

title: Will any NBA team launch an official cryptocurrency or blockchain-based token for fan engagement by the end of 2023?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2023, any NBA team officially announces or launches a cryptocurrency or blockchain-based token specifically designed for fan engagement. This includes, but is not limited to, tokens for voting on team decisions, digital collectibles, or rewards programs. The announcement must come directly from an NBA team or an official NBA communication channel. Third-party reports without official confirmation will not be considered. In the event of a dispute over the nature of the token or its intended use for fan engagement, the final decision will be made based on the most direct and clear statements from the involved NBA team or the NBA itself. If no such cryptocurrency or token is announced or launched by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will an international scientific organization establish a new global code of ethics for AI research by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, an international scientific organization recognized by the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) or a similar authoritative body establishes a new global code of ethics specifically for artificial intelligence research. The code must be publicly available, endorsed by at least 5 countries across at least 3 continents, and address at least the following areas:

- AI safety and reliability
- Transparency and accountability in AI development and deployment
- Privacy and data protection
- Fairness and non-discrimination in AI applications
- Environmental sustainability of AI systems

In the event that multiple organizations propose different codes, the question will resolve as Yes only if one code becomes widely recognized as the standard, receiving formal endorsement from the majority of participating countries. If no such code is established by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major astronomical discovery lead to the creation of a new industry by 2040?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2040, a discovery in the field of astronomy leads to the establishment of a new industry that meets the following criteria:

- The discovery must be related to a celestial phenomenon or object that was previously unknown or not fully understood.

- The new industry must be directly based on the application or exploitation of the astronomical discovery.

- The industry must have at least 10 companies or entities with a combined market valuation of over $1 billion USD, or equivalent in other currencies, adjusted for inflation to 2023 levels.

- The industry must be recognized as a distinct economic sector by at least two major financial reporting services, such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or similar.

- The industry must have created at least 1,000 jobs globally.

In the event that multiple discoveries lead to the creation of new industries, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one industry meets the above criteria.

If the discovery is made but the industry has not reached the specified scale by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

In the case of ambiguity or disputes over whether an industry is 'new' or based on the astronomical discovery, a panel of experts from the International Astronomical Union (IAU) will be consulted for a final decision.

title: Will a candidate with a policy platform focused on nuclear technology reform win the 2024 US presidential election?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if a candidate whose policy platform includes significant reforms in nuclear technology (including but not limited to nuclear energy production, nuclear waste management, and nuclear arms control) wins the 2024 US presidential election. The candidate must explicitly mention nuclear technology reform as a key component of their policy platform during their campaign. The resolution will be based on the official results of the 2024 US presidential election as announced by the Federal Election Commission. In the event of a dispute over the election results, the question will not resolve until a final decision is made by the Supreme Court of the United States. If no candidate with a policy platform focused on nuclear technology reform participates in the election, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a professional basketball team in the NBA start accepting cryptocurrency for ticket purchases by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, any NBA team officially announces and implements a system allowing for the purchase of game tickets using one or more forms of cryptocurrency. The announcement must be verifiable through official team communications, such as press releases, official social media accounts, or the team's official website. Transactions must be directly processed in cryptocurrency without requiring conversion to fiat currency at the point of sale. This resolution criteria does not include third-party resellers or platforms that offer cryptocurrency transactions independently of the team's direct sales channels. In the event that the NBA as an organization implements a league-wide policy allowing or mandating cryptocurrency transactions for ticket sales, this will also result in a resolution of Yes.

title: Will a cryptocurrency designed to fund environmental science research projects enter the top 50 by market capitalization before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if a cryptocurrency specifically designed to fund environmental science research projects enters the top 50 cryptocurrencies by market capitalization before January 1, 2030. Market capitalization will be determined based on data from a recognized financial data provider such as CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko. The cryptocurrency must be explicitly dedicated to funding environmental science research projects, as stated in its whitepaper or official documentation. In the event of a dispute regarding the cryptocurrency's purpose, the final decision will rest with Metaculus Admins. If no cryptocurrency meets these criteria by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will an AI system solve a previously unsolved problem in theoretical physics by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, an AI system is officially credited with solving a problem in theoretical physics that, as of the date of this question, has not been solved. The problem must be recognized as unsolved by a reputable scientific body (e.g., the International Union of Pure and Applied Physics) and the solution must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal of high impact (e.g., Nature, Science, Physical Review Letters). The AI's contribution must be substantial and clearly delineated, with the AI being the primary solver of the problem. The solution must be acknowledged by the scientific community and lead to a significant advancement in the field. In case of disputes, a panel of experts appointed by a recognized scientific organization will make the final determination. Edge cases, such as partial solutions or contributions to a larger team effort, will be evaluated on a case-by-case basis, with the AI needing to be the key contributor to the solution. Solutions achieved through brute force methods without demonstrating novel insight or understanding will not qualify.

title: Will the Virginia Department of Health implement a statewide health monitoring system using AI by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the Virginia Department of Health (VDH) has officially announced and implemented a statewide health monitoring system that utilizes artificial intelligence (AI) technologies for at least one of the following purposes:

Disease surveillance and prediction, including but not limited to COVID-19, influenza, and other infectious diseases.
Public health data analysis and forecasting to inform policy decisions and health advisories.
Personalized health recommendations for residents based on AI analysis of health data.

The system must be operational and accessible to the public or to health professionals statewide. The resolution will be based on official statements from the VDH, press releases, or government publications. In the absence of clear public announcements, credible news reports from major media outlets will be considered.

In the event that the VDH announces the development of such a system but it is not fully implemented by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. If the system is implemented but does not utilize AI technologies as defined by leading industry standards at the time of implementation, the question will also resolve as No.

title: Will a testable prediction from string theory be confirmed through space exploration missions by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, any of the following criteria are met:

- A space exploration mission, recognized by the International Astronomical Union (IAU) or a similar authoritative body, confirms a prediction unique to string theory that is distinguishable from predictions of other theoretical frameworks.

- A peer-reviewed scientific publication presents empirical evidence from space exploration missions that is widely accepted by the scientific community as a confirmation of a testable prediction from string theory.

- An official statement from a major space agency (e.g., NASA, ESA, Roscosmos, CNSA, ISRO) or a renowned scientific organization (e.g., the American Physical Society, the Royal Astronomical Society) acknowledges the confirmation of a string theory prediction through space exploration.

In the event that multiple interpretations of the results exist, the resolution will be based on the consensus within the scientific community as reflected in a majority of publications and expert opinions.

If no confirmation is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new nuclear technology emerge by 2025 that significantly reduces the risk of infectious disease spread through radiation exposure?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a new nuclear technology has been developed and demonstrated to significantly reduce the risk of infectious disease spread through radiation exposure. The technology must meet the following criteria:

1. Peer-Reviewed Publication: The technology must be described in a peer-reviewed scientific publication, confirming its efficacy and safety.

2. Official Recognition: The technology must be recognized by a reputable international body such as the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) or the World Health Organization (WHO) as a significant advancement in reducing infectious disease spread through radiation exposure.

3. Practical Deployment: There must be evidence of the technology's deployment in at least one nuclear facility, with documented results showing a reduction in the risk of infectious disease spread.

4. Expert Consensus: A panel of experts in the field of nuclear safety and infectious diseases must reach a consensus that the technology represents a significant improvement over existing methods.

In the absence of such a technology, the question will resolve as No. If the technology emerges but does not meet all the above criteria by the resolution date, the question will also resolve as No.

title: Will President Joe Biden announce a new federal initiative focused on advancing quantum computing technology before the end of 2023?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before December 31, 2023, President Joe Biden or an official White House spokesperson announces a new federal initiative specifically aimed at advancing quantum computing technology. The announcement must be made through official channels, such as a White House press release, a presidential speech, or an official statement on the White House website. The initiative must be new and not a continuation or rebranding of existing programs. The announcement must include a clear description of the goals, scope, and funding dedicated to the initiative. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. In the event that President Joe Biden is no longer in office before the resolution date, the question will resolve as No unless the acting or new president makes a comparable announcement.

title: Will NASA discover a particle with properties beyond the Standard Model of particle physics by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, NASA (or any entity collaborating with NASA on relevant projects) announces the discovery of a particle that exhibits properties not accounted for by the Standard Model of particle physics. The discovery must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal and confirmed by at least one independent research group. The announcement must be made through official NASA channels or a recognized scientific publication. In the event that NASA ceases to exist or is merged into another entity, the resolution will apply to the successor organization. If the discovery is retracted or disproven by December 31, 2035, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the global market share of robotics in manufacturing surpass 50% by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the global market share of robotics in manufacturing exceeds 50%, as reported by a recognized authority such as the International Federation of Robotics or an equivalent organization. The market share will be determined by the percentage of manufacturing processes that utilize robotics technology in any capacity, including but not limited to assembly, packaging, and quality control. In the event that specific data for the year 2030 is not available by the resolution date, the most recent data available will be used to determine the outcome. If no authoritative report or data is released by July 1, 2031, the question will resolve as No due to insufficient evidence.

title: Will the implementation of blockchain technology in carbon credit trading significantly enhance transparency in climatology data by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is a widespread adoption of blockchain technology in carbon credit trading that leads to a significant enhancement in the transparency of climatology data. 'Significant enhancement' is defined as a measurable increase in the availability, accuracy, and verifiability of data related to carbon emissions, carbon offset projects, and carbon credit transactions. This must be evidenced by a comparative study or report from a recognized authority in the field of climatology or environmental policy, such as the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) or the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC). The study should demonstrate improvements in transparency compared to the state of climatology data as of January 1, 2020. In the absence of a definitive report, a consensus among experts in the field, as reflected in peer-reviewed publications, may also be considered sufficient for resolution. Edge cases, such as partial adoption without significant data enhancement or improvements in transparency that are not attributable to blockchain technology, will not meet the resolution criteria.

title: Will the International Cricket Council adopt a technology-based system for real-time player performance analytics in official matches by 2025?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the International Cricket Council (ICC) officially announces the adoption of a technology-based system for real-time player performance analytics to be used in official international cricket matches. This system must provide instant data on player performances, including but not limited to batting averages, bowling speeds, and fielding efficiency, during live matches. The announcement must be verifiable through official ICC press releases or public statements made by ICC representatives. In the event that the ICC dissolves or undergoes a significant restructuring that impacts its ability to make such a decision, the question will resolve as No. If the ICC announces the adoption of a partial system that only covers some aspects of player performance or is to be used in a limited set of matches (e.g., only in World Cup or T20 matches), this will not fulfill the criteria for a Yes resolution. The resolution criteria are designed to ensure clarity and fairness, relying on authoritative sources for verification.

title: Will NASA's budget exceed 1% of the US federal budget by the year 2030?
body: Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if, at any point before January 1, 2030, NASA's annual budget is officially set at or exceeds 1% of the total US federal budget for the same fiscal year. The US federal budget refers to the total spending authorized by Congress in the annual budgetary process, as reported by the Office of Management and Budget (OMB). NASA's budget will be considered based on the figures provided in the annual budget request documents submitted to Congress, as well as the final approved budget figures as reported by NASA and the OMB. In the event of a government shutdown or any other scenario where the budget is not formally approved by the start of the fiscal year, the resolution will be based on the continuing resolutions or any temporary funding measures that specify budget allocations. If no specific allocation for NASA is provided in such measures, the question will remain unresolved until an official budget is approved. Edge cases, such as budget amendments or supplemental funding specifically for NASA that occurs after the initial budget approval, will be included in the calculation for NASA's budget percentage. The resolution will be considered final based on the budget figures for the fiscal year 2030, as reported by the end of the calendar year 2029.

title: Will the Food and Drug Administration approve a medication specifically designed for long-duration space missions before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) approves a medication specifically designed to prevent or treat health conditions caused by long-duration space missions. The medication must be intended for use by astronauts or space travelers and address issues such as radiation exposure, microgravity-induced bone density loss, or psychological stressors of space travel. Approval must be full and not conditional or for emergency use only. The resolution will rely on official FDA announcements or press releases. In the absence of a clear approval announcement by the FDA, credible news sources reporting on the approval based on FDA statements will also be considered valid. If multiple medications meet these criteria, the resolution will occur upon the first approval. If no medication is approved by the deadline, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Iran successfully place a satellite in orbit using its own launch vehicle before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the Islamic Republic of Iran successfully places a satellite into Earth's orbit using a launch vehicle that is designed, manufactured, and launched by Iran without significant foreign assistance. The satellite must complete at least one full orbit around Earth to be considered successful. The resolution will be based on official statements from the Iranian Space Agency or a recognized international space authority such as the United Nations Office for Outer Space Affairs (UNOOSA) or the North American Aerospace Defense Command (NORAD). In the event of conflicting reports, the majority consensus among these authoritative sources will be used to determine the outcome. If no satellite launch attempt is publicly acknowledged by the aforementioned authorities by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. In the case of ambiguity or lack of clear public records, the question will remain unresolved until sufficient evidence is provided.

title: Will evidence of supersymmetry be discovered in particle physics experiments conducted in space by 2040?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2040, any of the following conditions are met based on the results of particle physics experiments conducted in space:

1. Detection of particles that are consistent with supersymmetric partners of the Standard Model particles, as confirmed by at least two independent research groups.

2. Observation of phenomena that cannot be explained by the Standard Model alone and are attributed to supersymmetric effects, as recognized by a consensus in the scientific community or a reputable scientific body such as the International Union of Pure and Applied Physics (IUPAP).

3. Publication of peer-reviewed research in a recognized scientific journal that provides empirical evidence supporting the existence of supersymmetry, and this evidence is widely accepted by the particle physics community.

In the event that multiple experiments provide conflicting results, the resolution will be based on the consensus of the majority of the scientific community. If no consensus is reached by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

For the purpose of this question, 'evidence of supersymmetry' refers to empirical data that indicates the presence of new particles or forces that are predicted by supersymmetric theories and are distinct from those described by the Standard Model of particle physics.

title: Will a new class of antibiotics be discovered by 2030 that is effective against multi-drug-resistant bacteria?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new class of antibiotics has been discovered and is publicly recognized as effective against multi-drug-resistant bacteria. The criteria for effectiveness include:

- Clinical trial results demonstrating statistically significant efficacy in treating infections caused by bacteria strains resistant to at least three existing classes of antibiotics.

- Approval by a major health authority (e.g., FDA in the United States, EMA in Europe) for clinical use in humans.

- Publication of peer-reviewed research detailing the discovery, mechanism of action, and clinical trial results of the new antibiotic class.

In the event that multiple new classes of antibiotics are discovered, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first class meeting all the above criteria. If no such discovery is publicly recognized by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

For the purpose of this question, a "new class" of antibiotics refers to compounds with a novel mechanism of action not previously utilized in clinical settings for the treatment of bacterial infections. This excludes modifications or combinations of existing antibiotic classes that do not introduce a fundamentally new approach to targeting bacteria.
